intro: Eugenia capensis subsp. aschersoniana, commonly known as the Natal apple or Natal holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 2–3 meters and features glossy, dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in terminal umbels, followed by edible, red, apple-like berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant in subtropical regions. Its botanical characteristics make it both aesthetically pleasing and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
